intro: Lindmania savannensis, commonly known as the savanna lindmania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, often holding water. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Lindmania savannensis thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and forest edge habitats.
